articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian and European officials pushed back this week against some U.S. proposals on how to end Russia's war in Ukraine, making counterproposals on issues from territory to sanctions, according to the full texts of the proposals seen by Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Documents show differences over U.S. peace drive for Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Queues of faithful filed into St. Peter's throughout the night and in the early hours, on the last day to bid farewell to Pope Francis ahead of his funeral on Saturday.
articles.title: Faithful flock to St. Peter's on last day to pay respects to pope

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's former President Moon Jae-in said on Friday that prosecutors were becoming political and abusing their power and that his indictment on bribery was a good example. He made the comments during a meeting with National Assembly Speaker Woo Won-sik.
articles.title: South Korea's former president Moon says bribery indictment is 'political' prosecution

articles.author: Ted Hesson, Kristina Cooke
articles.description: After Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Taras Atamanchuk found safety for his family near Houston, Texas.
articles.title: In first 100 days, Trump tells migrants 'leave the United States'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China said it wasn't familiar with reports on Beijing planning to exempt tariffs on some U.S. imports.
articles.title: Beijing accuses Washington of 'misleading the public' about trade talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said his administration is talking with China to strike a tariff deal and that Chinese President Xi Jinping has called him, according to a Time magazine interview published on Friday as Beijing continues to dispute U.S. characterization of talks.
articles.title: Trump says China's Xi has called him and that US and China are in trade talks, Time reports

articles.author: Anastasiia Malenko
articles.description: You'll receive a generous salary, a bumper bonus and an interest-free loan to buy a home. The challenge? You'll have to fight on the frontlines of Europe's deadliest conflict since World War II.
articles.title: Cash bonus for a year fighting Russia? Inside Ukraine's youth recruitment drive

articles.author: Devjyot Ghoshal, Poppy Mcpherson, Pasit Kongkunakornkul
articles.description: Myanmar's junta has kept up a deadly military campaign, including airstrikes and artillery assaults, despite announcing a ceasefire after a major earthquake killed thousands in March, according to the United Nations and data from a crisis monitor.
articles.title: Exclusive: Myanmar junta defies quake ceasefire to continue deadly attacks, data shows

articles.author: Emma Farge
articles.description: The U.N. agencies for food and refugees plan deep cuts due to an unprecedented plunge in funding, including from former top donor the U.S., internal memos sent to staff show, raising questions about how to maintain hunger relief.
articles.title: UN food, refugee agencies plan deep cuts as funding slashed, memos show

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's President Vladimir Putin met U.S. President Donald Trump's envoy Steve Witkoff in the Kremlin on Friday, Putin's spokesman Dmitry Peskov was quoted by Interfax as saying.
articles.title: Russia's Putin meets US envoy Witkoff, Interfax says
